# SRPhotoplethysmogramSample

**Class**

The sample photoplethysmogram (PPG) sensor data.

## Declaration

```swift
class SRPhotoplethysmogramSample
```

## Overview

The PPG sensor provides an array of these objects as its [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRFetchResult/sample] type.

Apple Watch uses LED lights, paired with light-sensitive photodiodes (PD), to track the heartbeat-induced pulsations. Different Apple Watch models can have different numbers of LEDs and PDs. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRPhotoplethysmogramOpticalSample].

For more details, see:

- [https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204666]
- [https://www.apple.com/healthcare/docs/site/Apple_Watch_Arrhythmia_Detection.pdf]
- [https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211027]
- [https://www.apple.com/healthcare/docs/site/Blood_Oxygen_app_on_Apple_Watch_October_2022.pdf]

## Accessing PPG data

- **startDate**: The start date of the photoplethysmogram (PPG) sensor data recording.
- **nanosecondsSinceStart**: The time in nanoseconds since the start of the data recording.
- **usage**: The method that the person or system uses to take the reading.
- **SRPhotoplethysmogramSample.Usage**: The possible ways that a person or the system may take a photoplethysmogram (PPG) reading.
- **opticalSamples**: The samples recorded by the photoplethysmogram (PPG) optical sensor.
- **SRPhotoplethysmogramOpticalSample**: A data sample from the photoplethysmogram (PPG) optical sensor.
- **accelerometerSamples**: The samples recorded by the photoplethysmogram (PPG) accelerometer.
- **SRPhotoplethysmogramAccelerometerSample**: A data sample from the photoplethysmogram (PPG) accelerometer.
- **temperature**: The samples recorded by the photoplethysmogram (PPG) thermometer.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
